title: Love Island's Eoghan Murphy on reality TV lockdown
text:
Eoghan Murphy is set to enter the Love Island Australia villa in Fiji on Monday night.

And speaking to News.com.au a week ahead of the premiere, the Gold Coast-based real estate agent said his routine is pretty much the gym, tanning and sleep.

The 24-year-old added that he's hoping to find a deeper connection with a 'natural-looking girl' on the show.

'Wake up, gym, tan and sleep': Love Island Australia's Eoghan Murphy (pictured), 24, reveals what it's really like on reality TV lockdown, in an interview with News.com.au this week

'It's pretty much wake up, gym, try and get a tan, sleep. I try and have about four naps a day,' Eoghan told the publication from his Fijian hotel.

'I just want to get in there and get coupled up,' he continued, adding that he's after a deeper connection with a 'natural-looking girl'.

'I definitely want a long-term relationship [out of this], something a bit deeper.'

Monday night's premiere episode will see Sophie Monk return as host, and five girls and guys get coupled up.

Old-fashioned values: The Gold Coast-based real estate agent added that he's after a deeper connection with a 'natural-looking girl'

Eoghan will enter as an 'intruder' and attempt to split up one of the couples.

Speaking to Who magazine last month, Sophie revealed that this year's season will see a lot of 'drama and diversity'.

'I think there's also a lot of drama because they are putting different types of people with different morals in there,' the 39-year-old explained.

Sophie said that producers have purposely mixed a range of ethnicities, religions and personalities to make the season more diverse than last year.

Diverse group: Host Sophie Monk told Who magazine last mont that the upcoming season will see a lot of 'drama and diversity'

'From their occupation to their ethnicity and religion, they're so diverse. It is a really good thing.'

The season will see single contestants going head-to-head while living it up in Fiji.

'We have IQ's that are all over the place... It'll be different and very dramatic,' Sophie, who just launched a beauty line with ModelCo cosmetics, concluded.

Love Island Australia premieres Monday October 7 at 8.45pm on Channel Nine.
description: Eoghan Murphy is set to enter the Love Island Australia villa in Fiji on Monday night.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
